main_definition: A close friend or companion, often used informally to refer to someone with whom one has a friendly relationship.

meanings_and_examples.example: John and Mark have been friends since childhood; John considers Mark his 'pal.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acquaintance with whom one is friendly or familiar, but not necessarily a best friend
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Hey pal, long time no see! How's life been treating you?' said to someone met again after many years.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Term of endearment used when addressing a male friend or family member
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Hey buddy, how are you doing today?' asked the father towards his son, using 'pal' as an informal term of endearment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: One who is not trustworthy, used in a sarcastic or humorous manner
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Don't listen to him; he's just a real pal when it comes to advice.' said with a hint of sarcasm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A nickname given informally, often implying camaraderie or close relationship
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Hey Pal, ready for another round of drinks?' asked the bartender to his regular customer.
